poem:
Title: "Ode to the Lime Ebike"

In the twilight of dawn,
with exhaled breath of
London awakening -
the chartreuse specter awakes.

Ed Wright, peddler of electric horses,
his hands on phosphorescent steeds,
forging trails of invisible ink -
the city's veins pulsating.

From Streatham to Bermondsey,
ebikes are no longer lost -
but owned, cradled in the
concrete arms of the city.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Whose Lime is it anyway? How the green ebikes took over our streets At about 7am each morning, Ed Wright arrives for his shift as one of Lime’s fleet of van drivers in Bermondsey, south London. At 64, he remains lithe and lively, cycling the seven miles from his Streatham home to Lime’s London warehouse on an ebike. This comes in handy when your job is to heave wounded and lost ebikes found across the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
